main event: A ball of fire, 1/3 the size of the full moon, was observed in the sky over Bryan, Texas.
interesting points: The object had a circular shape with a tail.
Two small trails appeared to drop off from the object.
The object was observed for 5-15 seconds.
The sighting was reported as a 'fire' color, circular object with a tail.
This sighting was recorded on a Project Blue Book record card.
sighted object: ball of fire, 1/3 the size of the full moon, with a circular shape and a tail
